ASME BPVC.II.A-2025 SA-1011/SA-1011M (ASTM A1011/A1011M} 
X3. HARDNESS PROPERTIES 
X3.1 Table X3. l lists the typical hardness values. 
TABLE X3.1 Typical Hardness Values 
Norn 1-The hardness values shown are at the time of shipment. 
Norn 2-Tests for hardness shall be conducted in accordance with the 
requirements of Test Methods EIS. 
Norn 3-The hardness values are Rockwell B scale as measured or 
converted from the appropriate Rockwell scales. 
Norn 4-The typical hardness values apply to the full range of steel • 
sheet thickness. Hardness tends to increase as the steel sheet thickness 
decreases. 
Norn 5-Hardness testing is commonly nsed to assess the relative 
fmmability of various designations of uncoated steel sheet. This assess­
ment done by many users is recognized to be only an approximation of the 
relative formability and therefore cannot be used as a specification 
requirement. 
Designation 
CS Type A 
CS Type B 
CS Type C 
DS 
Hardness-Rockwell B Scale 
75 or less 
75 or less 
75 or less 
65 or less 
SUMMARY OF CHANGES 
Committee AO 1 has identified the location of selected changes to this standard since the last issue 
(AlOll/AlOllM- 18a) that may impact the use of this standard. (Approved May 1, 2023.) 
( 1) Removed titanium equation from Footnote C of Tables 1 
and 2. 
(2) Relabeled Footnote J of Table 1 and Footnote G of Table 2 
as Footnote C in Tables 1 and 2.
